text: Reginald William Weaver (14 September 1905 – 16 July 1970) was an English professional footballer who played as an outside right. ==Career== Born in Radstock,Frost, p. 409 Weaver spent his early career with Llanhilleth United, Newport County, Wolverhampton Wanderers and Chelsea. At Chelsea he scored 8 goals in 20 league appearances between 1929 and 1932. He signed for Bradford City from Chelsea in June 1932,Frost, p. 409 and scored 3 goals in 8 league appearances for the club, scoring 1 goal,Frost, p. 389 before moving to Chesterfield in March 1933. At Chesterfield he scored 2 goals in 11 games in the 1933–34 season before returning to Newport County. He later played for Bath City and Gloucester City. He died in Gloucester on 16 July 1970. ==Sources== * ==References== Category:1905 births Category:1970 deaths Category:English footballers Category:Newport County A.F.C. players Category:Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C. players Category:Chelsea F.C. players Category:Bradford City A.F.C. players Category:Chesterfield F.C. players Category:Bath City F.C. players Category:Gloucester City A.F.C. players Category:English Football League players Category:Association football outside forwards
title: Reginald Weaver (footballer)
